attributes.action: Approve permission for Surrey's Air Ambulance to be stationed at Dunsfold Park
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Plans for a dedicated air ambulance service to cover Surrey and Sussex at Dunsfold Park have suffered a setback.
Waverley Borough Council urged planners to refuse an application to erect a hangar at the Surrey site, which is close to the Sussex border.

Surrey's Air Ambulance to have permission to be based in Dunsfold park so that lives can be saved!

The Surrey Air Ambulance had hoped to have the service running by next month and said another site could cost lives. The council said the applicant had failed to justify the principle of the development in terms of the site.

It also suggested that the use of the proposed buildings and site would have "a materially significant adverse effect on neighbour amenity in terms of noise and disturbance".

David Philpott, chief executive of the Surrey Air Ambulance, said the council's decision had left him "astounded". "I am unaware of any such planning application ever being rejected elsewhere in the UK.”

The air ambulance service had hoped to start flying by next month. The helicopter would be able to attend an incident anywhere in Surrey and Sussex. It should be given permission to base at Dunsfold Park so that lives can be saved!
